meanings.sent1: The temp filled in for the receptionist while she was on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a temp to help with the busy season.
meanings.sent3: The temp accidentally answered the phone with a funny accent.
meanings.sent4: Being a temp worker is like being a substitute teacher in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The temp's cheerful attitude made a positive impact on the office morale.

meanings.definition: To work as a temporary employee
meanings.sent1: She decided to temp at different companies to gain diverse work experience.
meanings.sent2: Many students choose to temp during their summer break.
meanings.sent3: He temped at the law firm for a week and learned a lot about legal procedures.
meanings.sent4: Temping allows you to explore various industries before committing to a full-time job.
meanings.sent5: Temping can be a great way to earn money while searching for a permanent position.

meanings.sent1: The temp of the oven needs to be set at 350 degrees for the cake to bake properly.
meanings.sent2: The weather app shows the current temp in Celsius and Fahrenheit.
meanings.sent3: The temp of the swimming pool was too cold for a comfortable swim.
meanings.sent4: The temp of the coffee was just right, not too hot or too cold.
meanings.sent5: The temp of the room was so high that everyone started sweating.
